info.name: Hypoglossal trigone
info.description: The hypoglossal trigone is a surface elevation in the floor of the fourth ventricle overlying the hypoglossal motor nucleus. It is located medial to the vagal trigone. The vagal and hypoglossal trigones are part of the median eminence which lies medial to the sulcus limitans
info.item: /Sections/Thick, Whole Brain/Coronal/Occipital to Frontal/6 Cor: Occ to Fr
/Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/8 Brain stem - dorsal view
